alert.note: Alert for Colfax (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 3:58PM MDT until June 12 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast New Mexico, including the following county, Colfax. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 358 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated the heavy rain from thunderstorms earlier today has ended. However, flooding will take several hours to subside due to anywhere from 3 to 6 inches of rain and hail earlier today. Never cross a flooded roadway. Travel with caution after dark and heed any road closures that may be in place. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Raton, Springer, Cimarron, Maxwell, Raton Crews Airport, Sugarite, Sugarite Canyon State Park and Philmont Scout Ranch. - This includes the following highways... Highway 64 between Mile Markers 303 and 361. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 412 and 460. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
